meanings.definition: The condition of having double vision.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he experienced diploses and had trouble seeing clearly.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her diploses after she complained of seeing two of everything.
meanings.sent3: At the 3D movie, the diploses made the characters look like they were jumping out of the screen.
meanings.sent4: Her diploses during the magic show made it seem like the magician had cloned himself.
meanings.sent5: The diploses in his vision made it seem like the world had suddenly doubled in size.

meanings.definition: A medical term for the simultaneous perception of two images of a single object.
meanings.sent1: The optometrist explained that diploses can occur when the eyes don't align properly.
meanings.sent2: The patient's diploses were causing confusion as they tried to focus on the target.
meanings.sent3: In the mirror maze, the diploses made it impossible to tell which reflection was real.
meanings.sent4: The diploses in the microscope view made the tiny organism appear larger than life.
meanings.sent5: Her diploses of the painting gave her a unique perspective on the artist's technique.
